meanings.definition: To migrate back to one's original place or country.
meanings.sent1: After living abroad for many years, Maria remigrated to her hometown.
meanings.sent2: The birds remigrated to the warmer climate as winter approached.
meanings.sent3: The cat remigrated to its favorite spot on the windowsill, much to the amusement of the family.
meanings.sent4: The memories of his childhood home always made him feel like he needed to remigrate, like a homing pigeon.
meanings.sent5: The idea of remigrating to the countryside filled her with a sense of peace and belonging.

meanings.definition: To return to a previous location or state.
meanings.sent1: The software program remigrated to its default settings after the update.
meanings.sent2: The river remigrated to its original course after the dam was removed.
meanings.sent3: The toy car remigrated to the top of the shelf, much to the surprise of the child.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts always seemed to remigrate to that fateful day when everything changed.
meanings.sent5: The old clock seemed to remigrate to its youthful ticking when wound up.
